citeinfo.title: Global GIS : MAS/MILS mineral location database information
Global GIS : global coverage

serinfo.sername: U.S. Geological Survey digital data series

citeinfo.othercit: 1 DVD-ROM; Developed by the U.S. Geological Survey; Published by the American Geological Institute; by P. Hearn ... [et al.].

descript.abstract:
This datalayer is a point coverage representing mine and mineral resource occurrence data worldwide (most thoroughly within the U.S.) and was published as part of the USGS Global GIS : global coverage database. It was derived from the MAS/MILS (Minerals Availability System/Mineral Industry Location System) mineral location database. This database was transferred to the U.S. Geological Survey from the U.S. Bureau of Mines upon its closure in 1996.
The USGS Global GIS database contains a wealth of USGS and other public domain data, including global coverages of elevation, landcover, seismicity, and resources of minerals and energy at a nominal scale of 1:1 million. The U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) and The American Geological Institute (AGI) announced a cooperative agreement that will focus on making the USGS Global Geographic Information System (GIS) database readily available to educators and the general public in the form of a DVD based world atlas.
descript.purpose:
This data is a general purpose global mines and mineral resources datalayer designed to support Geographic Information Systems applications.
This layer is intended for researchers, students, and policy makers for reference and mapping purposes, and may be used for basic applications such as viewing, querying, and map output production. This layer will provide a basemap for layers related to socio-economic and political anaylsis, statistical enumeration and analysis, or to support graphical overlays and analysis with other spatial data. More advanced user applications may focus on demographics, urban and rural land use planning and related areas including defining boundaries, managing assets and facilities, integrating attribute databases with geographic features, spatial analysis, and presentation output.
descript.supplinf: Portions of this metadata are taken directly from the American Geological Institute, Global GIS, Web pages: http://www.agiweb.org/pubs/globalgis/

idinfo.useconst: None. Acknowledgement of the U.S. Geological Survey would be appreciated.

cntorgp.cntorg: U.S. Geological Survey, Spokane Field Office

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows 2000 Version 5.0 (Build 2195) Service Pack 4; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.1.0.722

dataqual.complete: Contains all locations in MAS/MILS database as of time of download.

srcinfo.srccontr: Previous repository for the data presented here.

procstep.procdesc: Selected fields were extracted from the MAS/MILS database using and SQL query. The information in the DLAT and DLON fields was used to create an Arc/Info coverage (mas_sdd) using the GENERATE command. The SEQ field was attached to the .pat feature attribue table using the JOINITEM command. The information in all the ArcInfo tables were then turned into .dbf (dBASE) format to create the mas1.dbf, name.dbf, state.dbf, commodity.dbf, and bib.dbf files. All tables except the state.dbf are linked by the SEQ field. The state.dbf links to the mas1.dbf by the combination of STA and COU fields to form a unique join. An ArcView shapefile called masmil.shp was created from the original ArcInfo coverage (mas_sdd). All of the dbf files, except the state.dbf, can be joined to the masmil.shp using the seq field as the relate key.
Global GIS data was obtained via a DVD-ROM in the format of ESRI shapefiles. The shapefiles were then imported to ArcSDE layers using the ArcSDE command line importing tool, shp2sde, version 8.3.

cntinfo.hours: Monday through Friday 9:00 A.M. to 4:00 P.M. EST-USA

altsys.altenc: Explicit elevation coordinate included with horizontal coordinates

enttyp.enttypl: Global GIS MAS/MILS mineral location database information
enttyp.enttypd: Mineral locations in an ArcView shapefile format

attr.attrdef: Unique identifier common to both MARPLOT and the data record .

Unique 10 digit number which references records of information pertaining to a mineral property. A 3 digit state/nation code is assigned to field positions 1-3; 3 digit county/province code assigned to field positions 4-6 (for the United States, this is the county code from the Dept. of Commerce. For foreign deposit, this is the province or political subdivision code as defined by the Minerals Availability Field Office; For ocean mining, the code is the marsden square, a unique 3 digit number from 001-999 which represents an area on the earth's surface of 10 degrees latitude by 10 degrees latitude; 4 digit deposit reference number to field positions 7-10.
Indicates whether the mineral deposit is domestic (a state or territory of the United States) or foreign
Name of the deposit or operation (primary or most common name)

Type of operation refers to the existing/proposed/past type of operation at this site . It identifies the existing operation when CURrent states equals "PRODUCER, PAST PRODUCER, TEMP SHUTDOWN, or DEVEL DEPOSIT'. It identifies the proposed operation when CURrent status equals 'EXP PROSPECT or RAW PROSPECT'. All processing plants will be coded 'PROC PLANT' here and further defined with the PLant Type (PLT) and Plant IDentifier (PID) fields.
Current status indicates the operating status of the sites at time of last modification.

edom.edomvd: Operates only part of the year. Production interrupted due to seasonal, stockpiling, or other physical restrictions on a regular basis.
Previously operating mineral property, where the equipment or structures have been removed or abandoned.
Resource not defined by exploration methods
Temporary halt in mineral production, where the property is under care and maintenance status or this status is designated by the current owner and/or operator.

attr.attrdef: Latitude in decimal degrees
Longitude in decimal degrees
Point of reference, indicates the physical determination point for the elevation, latitude and longitude data
Precision of point gives the precision or maximum deviation from exact POR in meters.
Elevation of the Point of Reference (POR) in meters.
Elevation precision. gives the precision of elevation in meters.
Datum of elevation provides for elevations to be expressed above or below either sea level or a local datum. The recommended reference is sea level whenever possible.
Year field checked. Year of an on-site evaluation check made by either personnel or contractors of the Minerals Availability Program.
UTM zone number
UTM hemisphere (North or South)
Map name of the largest-scale map available for the area of the deposit. If the name is larger than 17 characters it has been shortened to a recognizable name.
Scale of map identified in MAP field
Federal land status of this location.

edom.edomvds: Dictionary of abbreviations and acronyms in geographic information systems, cartography, and remote sensing.
Dictionary of abbreviations and acronyms in geographic information systems, cartography, and remote sensing.

attr.attrdef: Scale of the coverage used to determine the FEDLAND entry.
Domain describes the type of public or private land holding of the deposit area

edom.edomvd: Public land under Bureau of Land Management.
Property contains more than one surface estate.
Ocean bottom claimed by United States.
Ocean and lake bottom claimed by state.

attr.attrdef: River is optional. If left blank it is a computer-generated data field that will contain the name of the river basin indicated by the River Basin Code (RBC)

River Basin Code is defined in the U.S. Geological Survey Office of Water Data Coordination publication, Catalog of Information on Water Data-Maps Showing Location of Water Quality Stations. These maps show major drainage area boundaries coded from 1 through 97; each of these major drainage areas is further subdived into minor areas which are assigned letter codes.

codesetd.codesetn: Catalog of Information on Water Data-Maps Showing Location of Water Quality Stations.

attr.attrdef: Hydrologic Unit Code is an 8-character replacement for the RBC, currently being used by the Water Resources Division of the U.S. Geological Survey. This code more precisely pinpoints the water drainage area and it is recommended that it be used as an addition to the data provided by the River Basin Code. The code for a particular deposit can be obtained from a Hydrologic Unit Map for a given state. These maps have been published by the Water Resources Division of the U.S. Geological Survey and are availabe from the district office responsible for the state(s) concerned.

codesetd.codesetn: Adapted from Seaber, P.R., Kapinos, F.P., and Knapp, G.L., 1987, Hydrologic Unit Maps: U.S. Geological Survey Water-Supply Paper 2294, 63 p.

attr.attrdef: Primary type of mineral holding
Second type of mineral holding
Third type of mineral holding
Mine Safety and Health Administration (MSHA) Identification Number which corresponds to this particular property. Most often an operating or temporarily closed facility
Geological Survey's computerized seven character deposit number for their Mineral Resouce Data System (MRDS) data base entry that relates to this MAS deposit entry.
Type of evaluation is a single-character representing the type of deposit information currently on the data base.

edom.edomvd: Location information resulting from general sources; data may not be confirmed
Location information with validity confirmed through investigation by an evaluator
Resource data present, in addition to MILS information
Complete deposit description, often indicates thorough MAS evaluation

attr.attrdef: Year of initial data entry contains the four-digit year of initial entry of this property into the MAS database.
Contains the name of the principal meridian.
Survey status
Mining district name, when applicable.
Contains the principal owner/company name or a summary of the most significant owners identified with the operation. The first company listed was used for this field.
Date of last modification contains date of entry or the last modification made to the MILS table.
Commodities found at mineral properties (abbreviations)

codesetd.codesetn: MRDS Quarterly : Record and commodity summary.

attr.attrdef: First listed commodity found at site (abbreviations)

codesetd.codesetn: MRDS Quarterly : Record and commodity summary.

attr.attrdef: Modifier of commodity 1 and integral part of commodity
Marketability of Commodity 1. Indicator of the commodity's market status.

edom.edomvd: Primary product. Major product affecting revenue.
Co-product. A product of equal or near equal value to another product in terms of producing revenue.
Byproduct. A product that helps the economic viability of a property, but which would not be produced unless other primary products or co-products are being recovered.

Recoverable. A product that is not identifiable as a primary product, co-product, or byproduct, but is recoverable or potentially recoverable. The evaluator should identify in the comments if this is a commodity propsed for stockpiling if nomarket presently exists, or if reveues will exist, but the status of the commodity is unknown.
Affecting. Deleterious producsts or impurities that affect the marketability of the recovered product(s).
